channel.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
channel.description:
So word broke out today that Ubisoft has a 93-95% piracy rate. And that they're going F2P with pretty much all of their games. Opinions?
[url='https://www.pcgamer.com/2012/08/22/pc-gaming-has-around-a-93-95-per-cent-piracy-rate-claims-ubisoft-ceo/']https://www.pcgamer.com/2012/08/22/pc-gaming-has-around-a-93-95-per-cent-piracy-rate-claims-ubisoft-ceo/[/url]

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: striker
item.description:
He’s actually thinking of EA’s pricing stretegy, with their CEO saying sales cheapening IP and other bullshit.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: make82
item.description:
Seriously, I must admit, Ubisoft are, since the days of POP:SOT, and Far Cry, one of my very favorite PC game devs and publishers, I can’t understand HOW THE HECK anyone can believe that their games are ~95% pirated??? I honestly haven’t pirated a single Ubisoft title , and I don’t plan to! Therefore, I personally believe, that these “Piracy figures” are completely out of the @$$ of someone…???

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
You’re thinking of Activision, not Ubisoft.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
Even if the piracy figures where real, hardly surprising, they are the only publisher I know who keeps high prices regardless of how old the game is… take a look at Modern Warfare 1… still a high price for how old it is, and so on

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: striker
item.description:
MRPolo:

You all realize F2P means drop in quality of games produced right?

Not necessarily, afterall they want it to be fun, so you pay either for shit you don’t need or shit you need to advance ingame.
What bothers me is, that even if you want to play it you’re forced to buy every weapon or unit to see or use everything.
Very seldomly let’s a F2P title you play the whole thing without having to buy missions, gear, or anything else to that length.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
MRPolo:

You all realize F2P means drop in quality of games produced right?

My hours of playtime put into Blacklight and Tribes say no.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: Evod
item.description:
Gregorovich!:

I know this is a stretch, but does anybody know of any ‘F2P’ games which are actually free?

You mean like a developer spending alot of money on a game and then sending it out to the public for free.

I don’t think so.

Unless you count a really old game a developer made before made free like Bethesda’s Daggerfall.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: Gregorovich
item.description:
I know this is a stretch, but does anybody know of any ‘F2P’ games which are actually free?

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: striker
item.description:
Bloodshot:

If this had any truth to it at all, it would be more like 93-95% of Ubisoft’s PC games are pirated, because people would rather put their money towards other companies than deal with the shit they have to go through for a Ubisoft PC game.

Actually it’s like many of ubisoft’s games aren’t wanted by anybody. So they don’t blame the crappy game for selling bad, no: it’s always the (not) fans that aren’t bying it. But the game is the “best ever made” in their opinion, so actually of those 7billion costumers most of them just have to pirate it for the sales projections to be true. That’s where their logic comes from.

dky.tehkingd.u:

Unless they go full retard mode and pull an EA. coughgens2cough

Oh wait nobody but EA can be that stupid.

…

Can they? :fffuuu:

I think EA is setting the dumb-standard for the whole industry. Ubisoft is just copy-catting.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Well I recently bought The Settlers 6, didn’t notice much DRM really. Or is it hidden somehow

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
lunertexcosmo:

They can’t really make AC3 F2P since people have already started preordering the game.

Unless they go full retard mode and pull an EA. coughgens2cough

Oh wait nobody but EA can be that stupid.

…

Can they? :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: lunertexcosmo
item.description:
Kairouseki:

I doubt any of those will be F2P.

I think they only mean future titles. They can’t really make AC3 F2P since people have already started preordering the game.

F2P can be a very effective model if employed correctly. Unfortunately, companies seem to like the idea of pay to win, which is redundant. Love it or hate it, Valve got it right in TF2/DOTA 2. Sure, not everyone likes the hats but it’s made a killing for Valve.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubisoft Goes F2P
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
AssCreed 3, Watch_Dogs, and Far Cry 2 (somewhat) are their games that I’m looking forward to. I doubt any of those will be F2P.

Read full topic
